David,

  Thank you very much for the reply.  I am using JUnit 4 with the @=
After annotation.  I can't quite tell what the issue is, but it seems that =
maybe IDEA and/or TeamCity is not always reporting all of the errors when t=
here is a multiple exception scenario.  I was doing some testing after my o=
riginal post, and the behavior was inconsistent.

  Regardless, am I missin=
g anything here with respect to a way to assert state after any test in a c=
lass is run?  I've seen many posts where people preach about not asserting =
in tearDown/@After, but no one seems to offer any alternatives.  Is this si=
mply something not currently available in JUnit?  If not, I wonder if this =
is something the current maintainers would consider useful.  Maybe an @Afte=
rAssert or something that notes a method that should be run after the test =
only if the test did not have any assertion failures itself.

Regards,
Paul=
